channel.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
channel.description:
[size=20pt]THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN BECAUSE OF MY SERVER ITS BECAUSE OF GODADDY'S DEDICATED SERVER!!!
[/size]
[size=12pt]After 3-4 people log onto the server no one else can get on??? WTF?[/size]
Server ERRORS: [img]http://img242.imageshack.us/img242/6659/sshwtfjb2.png[/img] [size=15pt][b]UN-SOLVED[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]
NOW WHY DOES THIS HAPPEN? ^^^^
3-4 accounts can log on in the first 2-5min of the server being up then NO ONE else can log on, any help?!?!? [/b][/size]

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @pwnm30rdi3 pwnm30rdi3
item.description:
@pwnm30rdi3 wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:16, topic:172934”]Try one of those memory optimizers. Like i use it sometimes, when i run a server, an hour later or so, it uses about 200Mb + of my ram. So when i turn it off for a restart, it takes about 2 minutes for the server to be active again, because I’m using the program.

Use the memory optimizer to bring back memory from the cache.

EDIT:

(Of course this applies if you dedicated is at your house, because you didn’t tell me how it works.)

Oh and you might want to to stop alot of processes from running when the computer is started. I see you have Norton, it wastes alot of memory, so disable that on startup as well as other programs that aren’t necessary.

Start>Run>MsConfig>Startup Tab

Start>Run>MsConfig>Services Tab (Make sure to tick hide all microsoft services).[/quote]

The server is running at goddady and its linux/ SSH

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Try one of those memory optimizers. Like i use it sometimes, when i run a server, an hour later or so, it uses about 200Mb + of my ram. So when i turn it off for a restart, it takes about 2 minutes for the server to be active again, because I’m using the program.

Use the memory optimizer to bring back memory from the cache.

EDIT:

(Of course this applies if you dedicated is at your house, because you didn’t tell me how it works.)

Oh and you might want to to stop alot of processes from running when the computer is started. I see you have Norton, it wastes alot of memory, so disable that on startup as well as other programs that aren’t necessary.

Start>Run>MsConfig>Startup Tab

Start>Run>MsConfig>Services Tab (Make sure to tick hide all microsoft services).

Read full topic

Also, my computer hiberinated and i lost my ssh connection and my server has down time, SHIT

W W E, I posted the max players up a few posts ago. Its 500 players

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @pwnm30rdi3 pwnm30rdi3
item.description:
@pwnm30rdi3 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:10, topic:172934”][quote author=pwnm30rdi3 link=topic=233148.msg1993813#msg1993813 date=1200217093]

@echo off title Run server. java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

1024m=1gb
[/quote]

Along with all those jar imports which are completely useless too, right? ;)[/quote]

After i fix that it still wont effect anything right?

Taharok, can u pm me?

I did the run.bat thing nothing changed ^^

public static int MaxConnections = 500;

Thats my max connections, so its not that!

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“pwnm30rdi3, post:9, topic:172934”] @echo off title Run server. java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

1024m=1gb[/quote]

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @pwnm30rdi3 pwnm30rdi3
item.description:
@pwnm30rdi3 wrote:

@echo off title Run server. java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

1024m=1gb

[quote=“Taharok, post:8, topic:172934”]Change the startup command to the following:

java -Xmx500m -cp . server

This allows the jvm to use up to 500mb of ram, if it needs that much.

And by the way, don’t use such large client.java’s. The server creates a new instance of that class everytime someone logs in, and that is a load of memory to be wasted. The winterlove serve was not made for production, it was made for client learning.[/quote]

this means change the batch file, right?

Also my client.java is only 543kb and almost every skill works…

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated SERVER, WTF look!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Change the startup command to the following:

java -Xmx500m -cp . server

This allows the jvm to use up to 500mb of ram, if it needs that much.

And by the way, don’t use such large client.java’s. The server creates a new instance of that class everytime someone logs in, and that is a load of memory to be wasted. The winterlove serve was not made for production, it was made for client learning.

Read full topic

@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Nah, like what i mean is…

Turn off your server, and go check how much ram is being used, it might be from something else, i’ve never used a dedicated server before, and i doubt one is shipped to you + you paying for its expenses, but it looks like your hosting it from your computer?

Well anyways do what i stated first.
